entry.title: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas Moran's 1872 painting The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone (pictured) influenced the decision to preserve Yellowstone National Park for future generations?

entry.title: Tala Bashmi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tala Bashmi played on the Bahrain women's national football team for seven years before opening a restaurant in a Manama hotel?

entry.title: The Papers of Benjamin Franklin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when The Papers of Benjamin Franklin is completed, it is expected to contain approximately 30,000 writings in 47 volumes?

entry.title: Liu Yunbin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Liu Yunbin, the son of the second president of the People's Republic of China, was a graduate in radiochemistry and contributed to the development of China's first atomic bomb?

entry.title: Midnights (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Taylor Swift announced her upcoming album, Midnights, while accepting the 2022 Video of the Year award?

entry.title: Bill Renwick (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Bill Renwick was asked to review a neo-Nazi case at the University of Waikato it was meant to take three weeks, but instead took nearly two years?

entry.title: Frequent Express (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that women- and minority-owned businesses built the Frequent Express high-capacity bus line in Portland, Oregon?

entry.title: specific noodle shop (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the 1970s, future Indonesian president Habibie would go to a specific noodle shop every lunchtime?
